sentences: Möödunud nädalal on kõik tööd ära tehtud.
context: "Tehtud" is the past passive participle form of the Estonian verb "tegema", which means "to do" or "to make". It functions as a verbal adjective and indicates that an action has been completed in the past by someone (often unspecified). The word can translate to English as "done," "made," "completed," or "finished." When used with auxiliary verbs, it forms various perfect tenses. In some contexts, it may also be used as an independent response meaning "agreed" or "settled."
